snippet: In storm-damaged neighborhoods throughout the city, trees, plants and shrubs have died or are dying by the thousands, the city parks department said.
abstract: Trees, plants and shrubs are dying by the thousands in New York City neighborhoods as a result of damage from Hurricane Sandy; city parks department has inspected nearly 48,000 trees in flood zones, and expects to take the dead trees away by the end of 2013 and have most of them replaced.
lead_paragraph: In storm-damaged neighborhoods throughout the city, trees, plants and shrubs have died or are dying by the thousands, the city parks department said.

headline.main: Bare Trees Are a Lingering Sign of Hurricane Sandy’s High Toll
headline.print_headline: Bare Trees Are a Lingering Sign Of Hurricane Sandy’s High Toll
